alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 03 at 3:59PM EST until February 05 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Louisville KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky... Stoner Creek at Paris affecting Bourbon County. .Steady light to moderate rainfall today will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stoner Creek at Paris. * WHEN...From this evening to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, water floods a few low roads on right bank of creek. At 20.0 feet, water enter yards of homes downstream of water plant. Parts of the Garrard Park flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 19.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued later this evening.
